item.title: Teaching
item.description: Machine Learning (6.867) [Course website] Principles, techniques, and algorithms in machine learning from the point of view of statistical inference; representation, generalization, and model selection; and methods such as linear/additive models, active learning, boosting, support vector machines, non-parametric Bayesian methods, hidden Markov models, and Bayesian networks. The course will give the student the basic ideas and intuition behind modern machine learning methods as well as a bit more formal understanding of how, why, and when they work.

item.title: Contact Us
item.description:
Email David’s email: dsontag {@ | at} mit.edu
FAQs How can I join the group as a PhD student? Which departments does David admit from? When are admissions deadlines? Does emailing him help your chances? (Answer: probably not). Link to resources for PhD admissions from Jean Yang and Philip Guo. How can I join the group as a MEng or UROP/SuperUROP? Want people who have done ML classes (list some examples) before.
